---641449471-1904122958-1359721689=:45297
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hello,

excuse me if my explanations were a bit confusing. It is a complex =
subject and
therefore quite difficult for me to explain it in English. So I=
'll try again:


The source
code of the mentioned websites (i.e. the html c=
ode) points in one area 
to a CSS
file, in which the instructions regarding=
 the layout are lying. This path
is =E2=80=9C.../web/detail.php?template=3D=
hp3_style=E2=80=9D However, the CSS file is not
really there, but lies behi=
nd the path 
=E2=80=9C.../sixcms/detail.php?template=3Dhp3_style=E2=80=9D. =
In between these two paths 
there is a redirect (HTTP 302) inserted.
To sho=
w the page in the correct layout, Heritrix or rather the 
Wayback-Machine h=
as
to pass through the redirect.
=C2=A0
Now I
detected that if I change the=
 source code of the archived website to right
path (which means, I bypass t=
he redirect) and open the website, it is shown in
the right way. If I open =
the unchanged archived website (in which the redirect has to be used), the =
layout is shown incorrectly.
=C2=A0
But the CSS
file had been clearly crawl=
ed, because I can open the file via the Wayback Machine
(entering the path =
which redirects to the other path) and then the=C2=A0 redirect is working a=
nd I see the right data file.
=C2=A0
Hope I
explained it a little bit clear=
er.
=C2=A0
Thank you
very much for your help
=C2=A0
Steph




_____________=
___________________
 Von: Noah Levitt <nlevitt@...>
An: archive-cra=
wler@yahoogroups.com 
CC: Steph <sherlock.h221b@...> 
Gesendet: 19:53=
 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
Betreff: Re: [archive-crawler] Problem with CSS=

 

=C2=A0 
Hello,

What exactly is heritrix not getting right automaticall=
y?

Noah

On 2013-01-31 06:26 , Steph wrote:
>
>
> Hello, me again!
>
> Sor=
ry for spamming, this will surely be the last mail for today. Promise! :)
>=

> The problem is now pinned down. The troublemaker is a redirect in the li=
nk to the css file. The source code links to ..../web/detail.php?template=
=3Dhp3_style. Then there's a redirect to .../sixcms/detail.php?template=3Dh=
p3_style. If I change the source code locally to the right path, the site w=
orks fine.
>
> Is there any chance for Heritrix to get this right automatic=
ally? My value of MaxTransHops is already 3, so this shouldn't be problemat=
ic.
>
> Steph
>
>
> -------------------------------------------------------=
---
--
> *Von:* Steph sherlock.h221b@...>
> *An:* "archive-crawler@ya=
hoogroups.com" archive-crawler@yahoogroups.comnlevitt@..." nlevitt@=
archive.org>
> *Gesendet:* 12:48 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
> *Betreff:* Re=
: [archive-crawler] Problem with CSS
>
> Hello again!
>
> After further inv=
estigation I am now able to pinpoint the issue more exactly. This morning I=
 experimentally undid the rewritings of the urls in my archived page. And w=
as surprised to see it work smoothly. I found out that the problem seems to=
 lie in the css files or the rewriting of the links to the css files. When =
I undo these rewrites the site comes up perfectly. But I think this isn't t=
he best solution as I still rely on the css files on the liveweb and not on=
 my archived sites and files.
>
> Maybe this helps to get a little further?=

>
> Steph
>
>
> ----------------------------------------------------------=

--
> *Von:* Steph sherlock.h221b@...>
> *An:* Noah Levitt nlevitt@ar=
chive.orgarchive-crawler@yahoogroups.com" archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com>
=
> *Gesendet:* 9:44 Donnerstag, 31.Januar 2013
> *Betreff:* Re: [archive-cra=
wler] Problem with CSS
>
> Hello Noah!
>
> Thanks for your reply!
>
> Yes, =
I use Wayback Machine Beta for replaying it.
>
> Like you said, I did a che=
ck for broken links this morning (using Xenu link sleuth) and now I'm reall=
y confused. Due to the tests I did I got several archived versions of the s=
aid website. In some cases Xenu says everything is alright, in other cases =
he reports an issue concerning a file named index.jsp because of server err=
or (500) or (in other cases) page not found (404).
>
> I tried to find the =
jsp file to take a look at it, but it won't show up anywhere. Neither in th=
e live web version nor in my archived version... But Xenu finds an empty ur=
l almost every time .
>
>
> Steph
>
>
>
> ---------------------------------=
-------------------------
--
> *Von:* Noah Levitt nlevitt@...>
> *A=
n:* archive-crawler@yahoogroups.com
> *CC:* Steph sherlock.h221b@...>=

> *Gesendet:* 23:41 Mittwoch, 30.Januar 2013
> *Betreff:* Re: [archive-cra=
wler] Problem with CSS
>
> Hello Steph,
>
> Are you replaying your crawled =
content using wayback?
>
> You need to zero in on the issue. Browsers these=
 days have a way to view all the requests and responses as they go by (web =
console/net in firefox, developer tools/network in chrome, etc.) Open your =
url in wayback and look for 404s or other anomalies. When you see something=
 is missing then you can try to figure out why. If you don't see anything m=
issing at least you've narrowed it down and can continue investigating else=
where.
>
> Noah
>
>
> On 2013-01-30 02:14 , Steph wrote:
>  >
>  >
>  > Hi =
everyone!
>  >
>  > I'm new to this group and new to web archiving.
>  >
> =
 > I'm studying Media Preservation and for a project I try to save a few we=
bsites using Heritrix. It generally works really fine.
>  >
>  > But some w=
ebsites really give me a headache, because the layout won't work. The image=
s are all there, the Css files are also saved, but it won't show the define=
d frames! The content is just lined up, one below the other, instead of ben=
eath or above each other.
>  >
>  > I already raised the number of MaxTrans=
Hops and SpeculativeHops and it worked for a number of websites, but not fo=
r this.
>  >
>  > One of the websites is http://www.landesarchiv-bw.de http=
://www.landesarchiv-bw.de/>.
>  >
>  > Maybe you can give me some advice?
>=
  > It would be very appreciated!
>  >
>  > Thanks in advance,
>  >
>  > St=
eph
>  >
>  >
>  >
>  >
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
